t: How Precious Is Your Steadfast Love
To the choirmaster. Of David, the servant of the Lord.
Transgression*pn speaks to the wicked deep*ld in his heart; there*ln is no fear of God before*ld his eyes.
For*ln he flatters himself in his own eyes that*ld his iniquity cannot be found out and hated.
The*ln words of his mouth are trouble and deceit; he*ld has ceased to act wisely and do good.
He*ln plots trouble while on his bed; he*ld sets himself in a way that is not good; he*ld does not reject evil.
Your*pn steadfast love, O Lord,*s extends to the heavens, your*ld faithfulness to the clouds.
Your*ln righteousness is like the mountains of God; your*ld judgments are like the great deep; man*ld and beast you save, O Lord.*s
How*pn precious is your steadfast love, O God! The*ld children of mankind take refuge in the shadow of your wings.
They*ln feast on the abundance of your house, and*ld you give them drink from the river of your delights.
For*ln with you is the fountain of life; in*ld your light do we see light.
Oh,*pn continue your steadfast love to those who know you, and*ld your righteousness to the upright of heart!
Let*ln not the foot of arrogance come upon me, nor*ld the hand of the wicked drive me away.
There*ln the evildoers lie fallen; they*ld are thrust down, unable to rise.
